text: The important role of NSP5 hyperphosphorylation was further supported by the results obtained with the two phosphorylation-negative mutant strains, NSP5/ΔT and NSP5/Δ176-180, which possess Ser67 and yet failed to form viroplasms in MA104 cells. Surprisingly, the Δ176-180 mutant, containing the C-terminal tail, also failed to form viroplasms in MA104 cells, despite the absence of Ser or Thr within the chosen aa 176-to-180 region. Both phosphorylation-negative mutants tested did not replicate in MA104 cells, and we could not detect any structures containing viral RNA.
